results.title: Old life, new life
results.creator_credit: Raelanah Loloa, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: For Raelanah Loloa, moving from the town where she grew up in New Zealand to start a new life in Australia was an experience both exciting and stressful. It was hard leaving all her friends and trying to make new ones but, eventually, Raelanah and her family were able to build a new life in Australia.

results.title: Old ground new ground school ground
results.creator_credit: Open Channel Productions and John Nicoll
results.brief_description: An interview based documentary in which six Melbourne school students from non-English speaking backgrounds talk freely about themselves, their feelings and aspirations, and their experiences in Australian schools and Australian society.

results.title: Old enough but not ready: early recognition of learning disabilities
results.creator_credit: Barrie Angus McLean and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Learning Series”.
Derek behaves as if he had difficulty uttering words; Eugene is unable to follow verbal instructions such as “left”, “first, “after”; Mark has yet to use his hands as though the fingers are ten distinct elements. Children of six and seven who are bright and cheerful but for various reasons are not yet able to cope with the demands made in a Grade One classroom. Dr. Sam Rabinovitch explains the advantage of early recognition of learning disabilities in children. Shows the learning and teaching difficulties of these children.

results.title: Old dogs, new tricks
results.brief_description: You learn till you die … it’s the only way. Diminishing mental faculties are not a necessary outcome of old age. This heartening film focuses on a number of people for whom retirement and old age have only served as a springboard to new activities and skills. It clearly demonstrates that stimulation is an important part of keeping independent and motivated.

results.title: Old crafts new graces
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
Shows that, although the machine dominates the industrial scene of today, traditional British craftsmanship still plays an essential part in the production of certain goods. Examples illustrating such craftsmanship include: the making of a fishing rod; the work of the silversmith; skill with leather in the manufacture of saddles.

results.title: Old camp sites at Tika Tika
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “People of the Australian western desert (A)”.
Observation of everyday life continues, showing the women working at common tasks, mending a cracked wooden dish with spinifex gum and preparing a headache remedy from quandong seeds.

results.title: Old and new
results.brief_description: In her house Karen Adams is surrounded by old and new things. Objects that she finds in op shops and on the beach. Things that remind her of home. This digital story was created in partnership with the Koorie heritage Trust.
